Legal Status

U.S. FEDERAL LAW #

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    (Pick caffeine, DMT, dopamine, ethanol, harmine, MDMA, mescaline, serotonin, tryptamine, nitrous, THC, or psilocybin)

Psilocybin & Psilocin

Legal Status

by Erowid

U.S. FEDERAL LAW #

Caution : All legal information should be verified through other sources. [see below]

U.S. FEDERAL LEGAL SUMMARY Psilocybin REGULATED Yes STATUS Scheduled SCHEDULE Schedule I CLASSIFICATION Hallucinogen

U.S. FEDERAL LEGAL SUMMARY Psilocin REGULATED Yes STATUS Scheduled SCHEDULE Schedule I CLASSIFICATION Hallucinogen

Psilocybin and Psilocin are both Schedule I in the United States. This means they is illegal to manufacture, buy, possess, or distribute (sell, trade or give) without a DEA license. Psilocybin- or Psilocin-containing mushrooms have a slightly more complex legal status. Please see the Psilocybin-Containing Mushroom Law Vault.

U.S. STATE LAW #

California: (Oakland) #


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information about the legal status of psilocybin and psilocin, especially under U.S. federal law and specific state or city laws, as part of Erowid’s broader index on the legal status of psychoactive substances. It follows a brief reference to a donation incentive involving art glass molecules and appears within a legal overview focused on chemicals, particularly psilocybin.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    The SF-bay area city of Oakland de-prioritized / decriminalized the possession of "entheogenic plants" including psilocybin mushrooms, mescaline-containing cacti, iboga, and DMT-containing plants such as those used in ayahuasca on June 4 2019 at 23:12 (11:12pm) on a "unanimous vote" (although it appeared at least one councilperson abstained. This effort was lead by Decriminalize Nature Oakland. The Oakland resolution did not decriminalize opiate-containing plants. Congratulations to those who worked this successful campaign! The text of the resolution included: "RESOLVED, That the Mayor and City Council hereby declare that it shall be the policy of the City of Oakland that no department, agency, board, commission, officer or employee of the city, including without limitation, Oakland Police Department personnel, shall use any city funds or resources to assist in the enforcement of laws imposing criminal penalties for the use and possession of Entheogenic Plants by adults; [... and


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in a section summarizing the legal status of psilocybin and psilocin, specifically under "U.S. STATE LAW," providing a notable example of local regulatory changes: Oakland, California's decriminalization of entheogenic plants, including psilocybin mushrooms, as part of a broader legal overview within a page dedicated to the laws governing psilocybin.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    Department personnel, shall use any city funds or resources to assist in the enforcement of laws imposing criminal penalties for the use and possession of Entheogenic Plants by adults; [... and ...] RESOLVED That the Mayor and City Council hereby declare that it shall be the policy of the City of Oakland that the investigation and arrest of adult persons for planting, cultivating, purchasing, transporting, distributing, engaging in practices with, and/or possessing Entheogenic Plants or plant compounds on the Federal Schedule 1 list shall be amongst the lowest law enforcement priority for the City of Oakland; [...]" (last updated June 4 2019)


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is part of the section detailing U.S. state laws regarding psilocybin, specifically outlining Oakland, California’s 2019 resolution to decriminalize the possession and use of entheogenic plants—including psilocybin mushrooms—by making their enforcement the lowest law enforcement priority for city officials.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    INTERNATIONAL LAW #

Brazil #

Psilocybin and psilocin are listed as controlled substances, making production, distribution, or possession illegal. (thanks P)

Italy (Italia) #

Listed in Tabella I of "Tabelle delle sostanze stupefacenti e psicotrope", making it illegal to possess, purchase, or sell. (see Tabelle delle sostanze stupefacenti e psicotrope. (thanks a) (last updated Dec 16, 2015)

Norway #

Mushrooms that are dried, planted or otherwise "tampered with" and contain Psilocybin are considered Schedule I, and are illegal to buy or possess without a license. Pure Psilocybin is also Schedule I. See Norway Law. (thanks Y)

United Kingdom (Britain, U.K., England, Scotland, Wales) #

Psilocin is listed as a Class A substance. While psilocybin is not listed, psilocybin is considered an "ester" of psilocin and is thus also included in Class A along with "Fungus (of any kind) which contains psilocin or an ester of psilocin". (last updated Jan 22, 2013)

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This section provides a summary of the legal status of psilocybin and psilocin in several countries outside the United States, listing specific regulations in Brazil, Italy, Norway, and the United Kingdom. It appears as part of a broader document detailing the legal status of psilocybin and psilocin at the federal and state levels in the U.S., as well as internationally, along with disclaimers about the accuracy and currency of legal information.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Psilocybin & Psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid legal information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, government documents, websites, and other resources. We are not lawyers and can not guarantee the accuracy of the information provided here. We do our best to keep this information correct and up-to-date, but laws are complex and constantly changing. Laws may also vary from one jurisdiction to another (county, state, country, etc)...this list is not comprehensive.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

                    Context: 
                    This section provides a cautionary disclaimer about the legal information summarized in the document regarding psilocybin and psilocin, emphasizing its non-authoritative nature and the variability of drug laws. It also offers links to related resources and marks the end of the legal status overview for psilocybin and psilocin as presented by Erowid.
